intro: Berghesia, commonly known as the European thimbleweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Berghesia is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
